snippet: Château Latour is stirring tensions with a decision to stop selling its wines through middlemen in an attempt to hold more profit for itself.
abstract: Chateau Latour, famed maker of wine in France's Bordeaux region, is stirring tensions with its decision to stop selling wines through middlemen in attempt to hold more profits; move, initiated by luxury magnate Francois Pinault, upends time-tested traditions that have regulated wine business in area for centuries.
lead_paragraph: Château Latour is stirring tensions with a decision to stop selling its wines through middlemen in an attempt to hold more profit for itself.

headline.seo: Château Latour Breaks With a Bordeaux Tradition
headline.main: A Revered French Winery Breaks With a Bordeaux Tradition
headline.print_headline: A Famous French Winery Breaks With the Traditions of Bordeaux
